item.title: Quick Start: Linux Logical Volume Manager
item.description: While installing the latest Ubuntu OS on your computer, you will see that you can install the OS using LVM (Logical Volume Manager) utility. Ever wonder what is it? LVM (Logical Volume Manager) is that fantastic utility for storage administration. It provide the users with abilities which were not possible with raw disks. The storage is now ‘virtualized’. You can now easily create, move and extend volumes (for now, think of it as disk partitions) without bothering about data corruption.
